raw_comment:
- I noticed that the younger generation tends to believe that the world is getting better. I also noticed that there is a handful of countries that contain the younger generation and believe it's getting better.

- I wonder why the older generation doesn't believe that the world is getting better or is less optimistic. As well as to why there are only a few countries that took data on 40+-year-olds.

- This affects me because I am in the category of 15-24 years olds and others' outlooks on life can alter or shape yours directly.

- "Age determines optimism"
ace_sentences: I noticed that the younger generation tends to believe that the world is getting better.
I noticed that only a handful of countries contain younger people who believe that the world is getting better.
I wonder why the older generation does not believe that the world is getting better.
I wonder why the older generation is less optimistic.
Only a few countries collected data about people who are at least 40 years old.
I wonder why only a few countries collected data about people who are at least 40 years old.
I am 15 years old or older and I am 24 years old or younger.
The outlooks on life of other people can alter my outlook on life.
The outlooks on life of other people can shape my outlook on life.
The headline is: Age determines optimism.
